Choosing the right photo format is important for several reasons:

Image quality: Different formats have different levels of compression and image quality. For example, JPEG provides good quality with a relatively small file size, which is important for high-resolution photos. On the other hand, PNG provides lossless compression and better color accuracy, which is useful for graphics with transparency. It's important to balance image quality and file size, as large file sizes can slow down page loading.

Transparency: If you need transparency in your image, for example, for logos or graphics with transparent backgrounds, choosing a format that supports transparency, such as PNG, will be important. JPEG does not support transparency, so it is not the best option for these cases.

Animations: If you want to play animations on your website, GIF can be a great option because it supports image sequences.

Browser support: It is also important to consider which formats are supported by different browsers. Most modern browsers support JPEG, PNG, and GIF. However, newer formats such as WebP and AVIF may not be supported in all browsers. Therefore, the choice of format also depends on the target audience of your website.

Щоб дати вам уявлення про масштаб стисне: To give you an idea of the scale of compression used in this format, imagine an image weighing approximately 100 kilobytes. If the image information were stored uncompressed, each pixel would require three numbers - one for each of the red, green, and blue components. This would mean a total of 1,140,000 numbers, or about 1.2 megabytes. JPEG compression makes the original file more than ten times smaller! The process of compressing a JPEG image is not done all at once, but in stages.

В першу чергу цифрове зображення перевод: First of all, a digital image is converted from the RGB color space to YCbCr. In it, the Y component is responsible for the brightness of the image, Cb is the relative blueness, and Cr is the relative redness. The last 2 components are fully encoded, and the color information is reduced. This stage is somewhat similar to how human eyes work. The color receptors in our eyes, known as "cones," are divided into three types, each of which is most sensitive to red, green, or blue. Rods, the other type of receptor our eyes use to see, can only detect changes in brightness, but they are much more sensitive. There are about one hundred and twenty million rods in our eyes compared to a measly six million cones. This means that our eyes are much better at detecting changes in brightness than they are at detecting changes in color. If we can separate color from luminance, we can remove a little bit of color without anyone noticing. Color saturation subsampling is the process of representing the color components of an image at a lower resolution than its luminance components. Each pixel has exactly one Y component, while each discrete group of four pixels has exactly one Cb component and one Cr component. Thus, the image contains only a quarter of the information about the original color. The use of the YCbCr color space is not unique to JPEG. In fact, it was developed in 1938 for television broadcasts. Not everyone had color TVs, so separating color from luminance allowed everyone to receive the same transmission, and TVs that did not support color simply used the luminance component.
На цьому етапі все зображення розбиваєть:
At this stage, the entire image is divided into separate squares of 8×8 pixels, and a transformation is performed on each of them. At the same time, each square is decomposed into its color components to calculate the frequency of their appearance throughout the image. This level of compression is largely the defining feature of JPEG. After converting colors to YCbCr, the components are compressed separately. Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT) is the process of dividing an image into 8×8 blocks and converting each block into a combination of 64 patterns. It sounds incredible that any image can be represented using 64 special patterns. But this is the same as saying that any place on Earth can be represented using only two numbers: longitude and latitude. The surface of the Earth can be represented as two-dimensional, so only two numbers are needed. An 8x8 image has sixty-four dimensions, so we need sixty-four numbers. In terms of compression, it's not obvious how this helps us. If we need sixty-four numbers to represent an 8×8 image, why is that better than storing sixty-four luminance components? We do this for the same reason we converted three RGB numbers to three YCbCr numbers: it allows us to remove details that are less visible. It's hard to know exactly what the details that are removed at this stage of compression look like because JPEG only applies the discrete cosine transform to blocks of 8×8 pixels at a time. However, there is no reason why we can't apply it to the entire image.
At this stage, JPEG compression removes high-frequency details. Converting colors to DCT coefficients (patterns) is not a lossy operation. It is a lossy quantization step in which high frequency values, values close to zero, or both, are removed. When you select a lower quality setting for a JPEG image, it increases the threshold for how much of these values are removed, resulting in a smaller file size but a more "grainy" image. The amount of information removed from a JPEG file during this processing strongly depends on the specified compression level, and the higher the level, the worse the image quality will be. Such an image can never be restored to its original form. That's why JPEG is called a lossy compression format. The size of the file after compression in comparison with the original file directly depends on the detail of the image, and the more small details, the larger the file size. Images with less noise and more smooth color and brightness transitions are better compressed. The higher the contrast, the worse the image is compressed.
На цьому етапі стиснення кодуються кольо: At this stage of compression, the colors and brightness of the image are encoded. At the same time, only the differences of 64 pixel squares are preserved, and all identical information is removed. The results of this encoding are then represented by numbers, which are also compressed using a special algorithm. All the compression stages so far have been lossy. This last stage, on the contrary, is lossless. It doesn't remove any information, but it does significantly reduce the file size. How does compression work if no information is cut off? Think of a simple, solid black image. JPEG uses about 5000 numbers to represent it, but we can do much better. How can we do it with the fewest bytes? The smallest you can think of is four bytes: three to specify a color and one to define the number of pixels that have that color. The idea of expressing all repeated values in a short way in this way is called run-length coding. It is lossless because we can recover the encoded data exactly as it was before. The file size of a solid black JPEG image is much larger than four bytes, because remember that in the DCT layer, compression is applied to 8×8 blocks at a time. Therefore, at a minimum, we need one DCT coefficient for each 64-pixel block. We only need one because instead of storing one DCT coefficient followed by 63 zeros for this image, run-length coding allows us to simply store one number and say "the rest are zero". Delta coding is a method of storing each byte as a relative value compared to something before it, instead of storing its absolute value. This stage is characterized by the fact that headers are written to the JPEG. Headers are the first 500 bytes or so that contain metadata about the image, such as its width and height. Without a header, it is almost impossible (or at least very difficult) to decode a JPEG image. Each JPEG image is compressed with a code that is specific to that particular image. These codes are defined in a dictionary stored in the header. This method is called Huffman coding, and the dictionary (alphabet) is called a Huffman table. Each color component can have its own Huffman table. The Huffman tables have such a strong influence on the image because they tell us how to read the individual bits. So far, we've been dealing with binary numbers in decimal form. This hides the fact that if you want to store the number 1 in a byte, it will look like 00000001 because each byte must have exactly eight bits, even if it only needs one bit. This is potentially a huge waste of storage if you have a lot of small numbers. Huffman encoding is a method that allows us to relax this requirement that each number must take up eight bits.

The PNG format is an effective solution for storing images with transparency, gradients, and textures because it allows you to accurately reproduce these elements without losing quality. When using the PNG format, it is important to consider the file size. Thanks to lossless compression, PNG images can be larger than their JPEG equivalents. Therefore, if file size is a critical factor, you may want to consider other image formats.

In addition, it is important to use the appropriate PNG type depending on your needs. PNG-8 is ideal for images with a limited color palette, such as icons or small animated files. PNG-24 provides the full color spectrum and is used for images with rich details and gradients. PNG-32 is an extension of PNG-24 and adds support for the alpha channel for transparency.Overall, choosing the right image format, particularly PNG, depends on your specific situation. Consider your project needs, content type, and image quality criteria to determine if the PNG format meets your requirements.

It allows you to store images using less data, which is useful for small animation files or icons. PNG-24: This is a full color version of PNG that uses the 24-bit RGB color space. It stores each pixel in its exact color value, providing high image quality. PNG-32: This is a variant of PNG that additionally supports the alpha channel. It allows you to set the transparency for each pixel of the image, which gives you more flexibility when creating graphic effects and image overlays. This flexibility and support for transparency make the PNG format popular in graphic design, web development, and the creation of logos, icons, and illustrations. However, you should keep in mind that due to lossless compression, PNG files can be larger than JPEG files, especially for photos. To summarize, the PNG format is an important tool for storing images with high quality, transparency, and accurate color reproduction. It provides wide compatibility with browsers and is used in various industries.

GIF або Graphical Interchange Format — ц: GIF or Graphical Interchange Format is a type of highly compressed image. GIF, owned by Unisys, uses the LZW compression algorithm, which does not degrade image quality. Each GIF image is typically allowed up to 8 bits per pixel and up to 256 colors in the entire image. Unlike a JPEG image, which can display up to 16 million colors and touches the limits of the human eye. When the Internet came along, GIFs were still the best choice because they required low bandwidth and were compatible with graphics that consume solid color areas. An animated GIF combines numerous images or frames into a single file and displays them in a sequence to create an animated clip or short video. The color limit is up to 256 per frame, and it's probably the least suitable for playing other images and photos with a color gradient.
Концептуально GIF-файли мають графічну о: Conceptually, GIFs have a fixed-size graphic area filled with zero or more images. Some GIF files divide the fixed-size graphic area or blocks into sub-images that can function as animated frames in the case of an animated GIF. The GIF format uses a pixel depth of 1 to 8 bits to store raster data. The RGB color model and palette data are always used to store images. Depending on the version, a fixed-length header ("GIF87a" or "GIF89a") defines the beginning of a typical GIF file. There are currently two versions of GIF available: 87a and 89a. The first is the original GIF format, and the second is the new GIF format. In this file format, block characteristics and pixel sizes are mentioned in a fixed-length logical screen descriptor. The existence and size of the global color table can be determined by the screen descriptor, which keeps track of additional details, if present. A trailer is the last byte of a file that contains a single byte of ASCII semicolon.

Although the logical screen descriptor is separate from the actual header, it is sometimes considered a second header. The same structure used to store the title can store the logical screen descriptor. All GIFs start with a 3-byte signature and use the characters "GIF" as an identifier. The version is also three bytes in size and declares the version of the GIF file.

This table is mapped to index the pixel color data in the image data. In the absence of a global color table, each image in a GIF file uses its own local color. Протягом останніх 25 років JPEG був найб: For the past 25 years, JPEG has been the most widely supported format for web graphics. JPEG is a lossy compression format. Although the decoding speed of JPEG files is excellent, it lacks other features required for images on modern websites. JPEG does not support image transparency, animation, color depth maps, or the ability to layer. JPEG works best with photos. PNG is a lossless format and can support alpha transparency, but the compression achieved, especially for photos, is much lower. JPEG and PNG are widely used depending on the type of image required. Thus, the goal of modern image formats is to overcome the limitations of JPEG and PNG by offering the best compression and flexibility to support other modern features. Due to this need, the WEBP and AVIF formats have emerged and are now being actively implemented on various websites.
Формат WEBP був створений Google у 2011: The WEBP format was created by Google in 2011 as an image format that would help make the Internet faster. Over the years, it has become widely used because of its ability to compress images to smaller files compared to JPEG and PNG. WEBP offers lossless and lossy compression with acceptable visual quality and supports transparency and alpha channel animation. A lossless WEBP image is typically 30% smaller than a PNG, and a lossy WEBP image is 40% smaller than a JPEG image of similar quality. Support for animation also makes them a great replacement for GIF images. Формат Portable Network Graphics (PNG) б: The Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format was developed in 1995 as a universal substitute for the GIF format. It is a lossless image compression format, which means that the image quality is preserved during compression. One of the main advantages of PNG is the ability to use transparency. Since the PNG format preserves transparency information, it becomes very convenient for creating and using images with transparent backgrounds. In addition, PNG can be used to create images with an alpha channel, which allows you to make images translucent. One of the features of the PNG format is its ability to store images in TrueColor format with a palette of 24 bits per pixel. This means that PNG can store a wider range of colors than the GIF format, which uses only 8 bits per pixel. The PNG format can also store metadata such as copyright information, keywords, etc. This makes it very convenient for web designers and other professional users. Despite these advantages, the PNG format is not suitable for all cases. PNG images can take up more disk space than JPEG images, making it less suitable for storing large or high-resolution images. In addition, PNG does not support animation, unlike the GIF format. Some applications may have trouble displaying PNG images, especially if they don't keep their file format libraries up to date. In addition, PNG can be more expensive to process than some other formats. In general, the PNG format is a very convenient and flexible format for storing images. It can be used in a variety of areas, from web design to graphic design. However, before using PNG, you need to make sure that this format is suitable for a particular task, as it may have its limitations and drawbacks. To open PNG files, you need to use software that supports this format. On Windows and macOS computer operating systems, installing a simple image viewer such as Windows Photo Viewer or Preview usually allows you to open PNG files. There are also many image editing programs that support the PNG format. Some of the most popular programs in the field include Adobe Photoshop, GIMP, Paint.NET, and Inkscape. If you need to convert a file from another format to PNG, you can use specialized image conversion programs such as XnConvert, Format Factory, or Online-Convert. In general, you need to install the appropriate software to open PNG files or use online converters if you need to convert to this format.
getUserMedia (MediaDevices.getUserMedia): getUserMedia (MediaDevices.getUserMedia) is a browser API that allows web applications to access a user's media devices, such as a camera and microphone. This makes it possible to receive audio and video streams from these devices to use them for video capture, face recognition, audio input, and other web application scenarios. With getUserMedia, web applications can ask the user for permission to access the device's camera and microphone. If the user grants permission, the application can receive media streams and work with them. This allows you to create web applications that can conduct video conferencing, take photos through the camera, recognize faces, record audio, use sound analysis, and many other multimedia functions. However, it is important to remember that access to media devices such as cameras and microphones requires user permission. The user has the option to grant or deny access to their media devices when using the web application.
Запис відео у браузері здійснюється за д: Video recording in the browser is performed using the WEBM format, the video file can be converted to other formats such as MP4 or Ogg, but initially it is recorded only with the WEBM extension. The UserMedia tool allows you to record media files through the browser.
WebM є відео кодеком, який використовуєт: WebM is a video codec used to compress video in order to reduce file size and increase the speed of transmission on the Internet. It uses the open source VP8 video codec and the open source Vorbis audio codec, which makes it available for use free of charge and without restrictions. WebM supports high quality video and audio with minimal quality loss relative to the original video. In addition, it supports a multi-file container that allows you to store video and audio data in a single file. WebM is an open format, meaning that its development takes place within an open group consisting of representatives of various companies and organizations. This allows the format to be developed through collaboration and public interaction, which increases its distribution and development. WebM is a popular format for video on websites and is supported by most web browsers, such as Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and others.
Компресія відео: WebM використовує відео: Video compression: WebM uses the VP8 or VP9 video codec to compress video. These codecs provide efficient compression algorithms that reduce the size of the video file without significant loss of quality.
Компресія аудіо: WebM використовує аудіо: Audio Compression: WebM uses the Opus or Vorbis audio codec to compress audio. These codecs provide high sound quality with minimal file size.
Контейнер: WebM визначає структуру конте: Container: WebM defines a file container structure that combines video and audio data into a single file. This container keeps the video and audio paths synchronized so that they can be played simultaneously.
Висока якість та ефективність: WebM забе: High quality and efficiency: WebM delivers high quality video with a reduced file size. This makes it especially useful for streaming video on a network with limited bandwidth and resources.
Підтримка веб-технологій: WebM підтримує: Support for web technologies: WebM is supported by browsers based on web standards such as HTML5. This allows WebM video files to be played directly in browsers without the need for additional plug-ins or codecs.
Високоякісне стиснення відео: WebM викор: High-quality video compression: WebM uses efficient video codecs like VP8 and VP9 to compress video files without significant loss in quality. This allows for high-resolution videos with smaller file sizes, making them easier to store and transmit over the internet.
Відкритий і безкоштовний: WebM - це відк: Open and royalty-free: WebM is an open and royalty-free format, meaning that anyone can use it without having to pay licensing fees. This encourages widespread adoption and accessibility across different platforms and devices.
Широка підтримка браузерів: Більшість су: Wide browser support: Most modern web browsers, including Chrome, Firefox, and Opera, support WebM natively. This enables seamless playback of WebM videos without requiring additional plugins or software installations.
Ефективна трансляція: WebM оптимізовано: Efficient streaming: WebM is optimized for streaming over the internet, making it ideal for delivering video content in real-time. It supports adaptive streaming, allowing the video quality to adjust based on the viewer's internet connection, ensuring smooth playback.
Підтримка прозорості та альфа-каналів: W: Transparency and alpha channel support: WebM supports transparency and alpha channels, which means it can handle videos with transparent backgrounds or overlay effects. This makes it suitable for applications such as video editing, compositing, and animations.
Широка сумісність платформ: WebM можна в: Wide platform compatibility: WebM can be played on various platforms, including desktop computers, mobile devices, and embedded systems. It provides flexibility for developers and content creators to deliver video content across a wide range of devices and operating systems.
Інтеграція з HTML5: WebM тісно інтегрова: Integration with HTML5: WebM is closely integrated with HTML5, the standard markup language for web content. It can be easily embedded in web pages using HTML5 video tags, allowing for seamless integration and playback without the need for third-party plugins.
Обмежена апаратна підтримка: Деякі старі: Limited hardware support: Some older or less common hardware devices may not have built-in hardware decoding support for WebM. This can lead to increased CPU usage when playing WebM videos on such devices, potentially impacting battery life and performance.
Обмежений вибір кодеків: WebM переважно: Limited codec options: WebM primarily uses the VP8 and VP9 video codecs, which may not be as widely supported as other codecs such as H.264. This can cause compatibility issues when working with applications or devices that only support specific codecs.
Менш поширений: Хоча WebM підтримується: Less widespread adoption: While WebM is supported by major web browsers, it may not be as widely used or recognized as other video formats like MP4. This could pose challenges when sharing or distributing WebM videos to a wider audience who may be more familiar with other formats.
Компроміси щодо якості: Хоча WebM забезп: Quality trade-offs: While WebM provides efficient compression, the level of compression can impact the quality of the video. Highly compressed WebM videos may exhibit visual artifacts or reduced quality compared to less compressed or lossless formats.
Обмежена інструментальна та програмна пі: Limited tooling and software support: The availability of video editing software, conversion tools, and libraries specifically designed for WebM may be more limited compared to other more established video formats. This can make certain video editing or processing tasks more challenging or require additional steps for working with WebM files.
Міркування щодо інфраструктури потоковог: Streaming infrastructure considerations: While WebM is optimized for streaming, implementing a robust streaming infrastructure for WebM videos may require additional setup and configuration compared to more widely used formats.

Сімейство форматів MPEG (Moving Picture: The MPEG (Moving Picture Experts Group) family of formats includes various standards for video and audio compression. Here are some common MPEG formats:
MPEG-1: Цей стандарт був розроблений для: MPEG-1: This standard was developed to compress low-bitrate video with moderate image quality. The MPEG-1 format is used, for example, in video CDs and video on the Internet.
MPEG-2: Цей стандарт був розроблений для: MPEG-2: This standard was developed for high-quality video compression at higher bitrates, allowing it to be used for video broadcasts, DVDs, satellite TV, and more. It supports video compression in various resolutions and picture modes.
MPEG-4: Цей стандарт включає багато функ: MPEG-4: This standard includes many functionalities and was developed to compress video, audio and other multimedia data with high quality. It supports a wider range of capabilities, such as live video streaming, animation, 3D graphics, audio synthesis, and more.
MPEG-7: Цей стандарт визначає стандартиз: MPEG-7: This standard defines a standardized set of metadata for describing multimedia content. It provides structured information about the content, such as titles, descriptions, keywords, copyrights, etc. MPEG-7 helps organize and search engines and improves the management of multimedia data.
MPEG-21: Цей стандарт визначає інформаці: MPEG-21: This standard defines an information framework and set of standards for managing digital content. It provides mechanisms for copyright management, content protection, digital content transactions
Універсальна підтримка: Формат MPEG-1 є: Universal support: The MPEG-1 format is widely supported and can be played on many devices, including computers, televisions, DVD players, and portable devices. This ensures compatibility and accessibility for video playback using the MPEG-1 format.
Компресія з низьким бітрейтом: MPEG-1 до: Low bit rate compression: MPEG-1 allows video to be compressed at a low bitrate, which results in a smaller file size with acceptable image quality. This makes it ideal for transmitting video over limited data channels, such as the slow-speed Internet or to older devices with limited capacity.
Підтримка аудіо: MPEG-1 дозволяє вбудову: Audio support: MPEG-1 allows you to embed audio in a suitable format, such as MP3, which provides high quality audio compression. This allows you to create videos with a high quality audio track.
Простота використання: Формат MPEG-1 має: Ease of use: The MPEG-1 format has a simple structure and decoding, making it easy to use for developers and users. The availability of MPEG-1 codecs and software also contributes to its popularity and widespread use.
Підтримка DVD-відео: MPEG-1 є одним з фо: DVD video support: MPEG-1 is one of the formats supported on DVD video. This allows you to create DVDs with video that can be played on DVD players.
Обмежена якість звуку: Хоча MPEG-1 може: Limited audio quality: Although MPEG-1 can support MP3 audio compression, the audio quality can be limited, especially at low bitrates. This can result in loss of audio detail and compression artifacts.
Обмежена підтримка каналів: MPEG-1 обмеж: Limited channel support: MPEG-1 is limited in its support for multi-channel audio. It supports stereo sound (two channels), but does not support more complex audio formats with many channels, such as 5.1 or 7.1 sound systems.
Високий бітрейт для високої якості: Для: High bitrate for high quality: To achieve high audio quality, MPEG-1 requires a high bitrate, which results in a larger audio file size. This can be problematic when transferring or saving files with high quality audio.
Відсутність додаткових функцій: MPEG-1 н: No additional features: MPEG-1 does not have support for advanced features such as spatial audio, audio processing effects, low latency support, etc. This limits the possibilities for processing and improving the sound quality of MPEG-1.
